alert.note: Alert for Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 9:22AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Drenching thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Oswego County through 1015 AM EDT... At 920 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms with heavy rain along a line extending from near Mexico Point State Park to near Cicero. Movement of the line of storms was generally to the east at 15 to 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and tropical downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Central Square, Redfield, Mexico Point State Park, Selkirk Shores State Park, Hastings, Constantia, West Monroe, New Haven, Mexico, Williamstown, Cleveland, Parish, Altmar, Amboy Center, Howardville, Mallory, Gayville, Kasoag, Bernhards Bay, and Lower South Bay. This includes Interstate 81 between exits 32 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. One to two inches of rain will be possible with these storms and will fall over the same areas where heavy rain fell on Sunday. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
